intro: Vaccinium beamanianum, commonly known as the Beaman's blueberry, is a species of evergreen shrub native to the mountainous regions of Central America. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes many familiar plants such as blueberries and cranberries. The plant produces small, dark blue to black berries that are typically edible and have a tart flavor. Its leaves are oval-shaped, glossy, and arranged alternately along the stems. Vaccinium beamanianum thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and is often found in cloud forests at high elevations.
